page.title: 03CHURCHES IN HOLT (PART TWO)
page.content: Some people wanted churches separate from The Church of England so the United Reform Church was built. The main hall of the U.R.C. was built in 1813 and the Church that we know was actually a main exstention and it was built in 1880. The U.R.C. co-operates with St. Katharine's locally but not nationally. They have an infant baptism and sometimes they have an adult baptism.The U.R.C. Hall is used for Tiny Tots, Youth Club, Guides, Brownies and a Nursery School. The Church is closely involved with the village. It has similar services to the Church of England and holds family services once a month. They have Blessings, which are baptisms without water, so that children can choose whether to have a proper baptism later on when they become teenagers.
